Welcome to spycause’s documentation!

Spycause (/spī’ kôz/ or /e’ spē kôz/) is a Python package of spatial causal models, diagnostics, and tools for simulating data. All models are fitted in a Bayesian framework using the Stan programming language.

Contents:

  • Simulation code
    • CARSimulator
  • Models
    • Ordinary least squares (OLS)
    • Conditional autoregressive adjustment (CAR)
    • Intrinsic conditional autoregressive adjustment (ICAR)
    • Joint propensity score and outcome (Joint)
  • Diagnostic tools

Next steps for implementations: * Spatial diff-in-diff * Spatial instrumental variables * Geographic regression discontinuity design

References

Reich, B.J., Yang, S., Guan, Y., Giffin, A.B., Miller, M.J., and Rappold, A. (2021). A review of spatial causal inference methods for environmental and epidemiological applications. International Statistical Review, 89(4):605-634.

Stan Development Team. (2023). Stan Modeling Language Users Guide and Reference Manual, 2.31. https://mc-stan.org.
